div1.p: Hench discusses the photographs of the plaque placed on the building where Reed died.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to J.F. Siler, January 25, 1951
div1.opener:
January 25, 1951
Colonel J. F. Siler
Gorgas Memorial Institute
1835 Eye Street N. W.
Washington 6, D. C.
My dear Colonel Siler:
div1.p:
Thank you very kindly for sending me the four photographs of
the Walter Reed Plaque. I think the plaque is most dignified and the
photographs are excellent. I appreciate being allowed to keep these
for my file and to have the file in numbers.

I gather from your letter that you want to send only one copy
to each member of the Board of Managers. You will note that one of the
photographs shows the plaque best of all, others show the plaque with
diminishing clearness but show more of the hospital.

For those Washingtonians who know the hospital and know just
about where the plaque has been erected, I should think that the bext
choice would be negative 219473-05011; in other words, the close-up of
the plaque. For those who are not familiar with the hospital and who
for sentimental reasons might like to have a photograph of the hospital
where Reed died, I should think that negative 219473-05013 would be the
best. This shows a fair amount of the hospital but the inscription on
the plaque is not legible. For those who receive this photograph the
inscription on the plaque could be inserted in a letter.

If you want to compromise and give one photograph showing some
of the hospital but with the plaque still legible, negative 219473-05012
would be the best.

The fourth negative, 219473-05014 has no particular merit as
the plaque is not legible and there is not as much of the hospital in
this photograph as there is in the second one mentioned above.

To recapitulate, if you only send one film, I would choose
negative 5011 for the Washingtonians and 5012 for the non-Washingtonians
whom you might think would like to see a little of the hospital but
if the Institute of Pathology is willing to send two to each member,
I would suggest 5011 and 5013.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
